page.title: 02Stanlow Point
page.content: At one time, Stanlow Point was a sandstone outcrop on the shoreline of the {Mersey Estuary. }With the completion of the Manchester Ship Canal at the start of this century, the Point became an island. Access to the island today is difficult because of the security that the oil companies maintain. However, amongst the oil installations can still be found some low sandstone walls and blocks, the remnants of a Cistercian monastery established in 1178 and largely abandoned in 1294 due to storm damage. { }
